business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end flat as Dalal Street takes breather after hitting all-time highsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 13.71 points to close at 85,706.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 12.60 points lower at 26,202.95. The broader market also remained subdued, with most major sectoral indices finishing in the red.

Are millennials relying too heavily on SIPs for wealth building?Millennials swear by SIPs for long term investing, but are they mistaking convenience for safety? As market cycles turn unpredictable, is it time to rethink what "safe investing" really means?

From tax deadlines to LPG, pensions: 5 major financial changes starting December 1Before December begins, it's worth noting that several new financial rules will kick in, affecting your bills, savings and even travel plans. Whether it's cooking gas, pension rules or tax filings, here's what to expect as the calendar turns.

Sudeep Pharma shares rise nearly 29% over IPO price. What should investors do?Sudeep Pharma's strong debut has impressed investors, but with valuations now stretched, is this the right moment to book profits or should investors stay put and ride the long-term story?

From GMP to price band: 5 things to know about Meesho IPOThe SoftBank-backed e-commerce platform has set a price band of Rs 105 to Rs 111 per share, valuing the company at nearly Rs 50,100 crore at the upper end.

Will your pension stop after November 30? Check nowThe deadline to submit the annual Life Certificate is almost here, and missing it could put your pension on hold. Pensioners must complete the process by 30 November to avoid any interruption.

New labour codes bring major employee benefits, but what are the big challenges?The new labour codes promise stronger protection and wider benefits for workers, but the real test begins now as businesses brace for higher costs, major restructuring and a challenging transition across sectors.

Why is tax department sending SMS alerts to 25,000 taxpayers about foreign assets?Tax officials examined data received from foreign jurisdictions through the Automatic Exchange of Information (AEOI) system. This international framework allows countries to share details of financial accounts held abroad by their residents.

Meesho IPO opening on December 3: What investors need to knowMeesho IPO is all set to open for subscription, backed by strong GMP cues and rising investor interest, but can the value-commerce giant turn pre-listing hype into sustained market performance? Here is all you need to know.

Is your money lying unclaimed? Here's how Delhi's new campaign help you recover itThe move is part of the Centre's ongoing 'Apki Punji, Apka Adhikar' campaign, which focuses on returning such funds to their rightful owners.

Sudeep Pharma makes strong market debut. Hold or book profit now?A blockbuster debut has rewarded Sudeep Pharma IPO investors. Should you cash out while sentiment is high or hold on for the company's expansion and export growth story?

Sudeep Pharma shares list at 23% premium in strong market debutThe Rs 895-crore issue, which was subscribed an extraordinary 93.71 times between November 21 and 25, opened at Rs 730 on the NSE and Rs 725 on the BSE, against the upper-end IPO price of Rs 593.

GAIL share price tumbles 6%. Here's why the PSU stock is falling todayThe slump in GAIL's share price reflects investor disappointment over a tariff hike that landed far below expectations. With a full review pushed to 2028, the market is recalibrating its outlook on earnings support for the PSU major.
Sensex, Nifty take breather after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 65.92 points at 85,786.30 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 16.65 points to 26,232.20.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath says crypto derivatives need urgent regulationKamath described the current state of crypto derivative exchanges as "a bit like Schrödinger's cat — neither fully regulated nor unregulated."

ITR refund still pending? Here's how to check your status using PANIf your ITR refund for FY24–25 hasn't arrived yet, you're not alone. Many taxpayers are seeing longer delays this year. The good news: you can quickly check your refund status online using just your PAN.

New labour codes: 5 key benefits you must knowWith the new labour codes, gig and platform workers are now officially recognised, giving them entry into an organised safety net that includes insurance, PF benefits and pension provisions.

Markets at record high: Is a bigger bull run coming in 2026?After 14 months of waiting, domestic markets have finally broken past their earlier ceilings. Strong flows, better earnings and a powerful technical breakout now raise a bigger question about whether 2026 becomes the real breakout year.

Sensex, Nifty touch all-time highs before cooling off, investors await GDP dataThe S&P BSE Sensex added 110.87 points to end at 85,720.38, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 10.25 points to close at 26,215.55.
Why more companies are choosing flexible offices over owning spaceCorporations are now intentionally reallocating portions of their real estate portfolios into flexible and fully serviced workspaces.

entertainment.headline: Robert Downey Jr's new Avengers: Doomsday tease features Iron Man and Doctor Doom Robert Downey Jr has teased new artwork on his social media, leaving fans excited about whether his past MCU avatar of Iron Man has a connection with Avengers: Doomsday.

Tere Ishq Mein review: Dhanush-Kriti can't save this messy thesis on toxic loveRelease Date:Fri Nov 28, 2025 Tere Ishq Mein movie review: Tere Ishq Mein attempts to portray a complex story of toxic love and obsession. Despite powerful performances, the film's problematic narrative leaves audiences unsettled and triggered.

True to Love is the breakup survival guide we didn't know we needed A conversational take on how K-drama True to Love explores heartbreak, self-worth, and the slow, relatable art of letting go without spoilers.

Tarantino lists his favourite 21st century films, picks Spielberg over Scorsese Quentin Tarantino's 21st-century film list pits Steven Spielberg against Martin Scorsese, praising the former's musical as the most exciting film made this century and expressing surprise over his enjoyment of lead actor Ansel Elgort's performance.

Dharmendra honoured in 2 prayer meets; Sunita Ahuja recounts Hema Malini's ceremony Family and friends gathered at Hema Malini's home for a prayer meet to remember the late veteran actor Dharmendra, with notable personalities from the industry in attendance.

Apne 2 producer says film still in development, denies shelved claims Producer Deepak Mukut addresses speculation surrounding the status of Apne 2, assuring that the sequel is proceeding as a dedicated homage to the late Dharmendra.

Nagarjuna details 7-year effort to restore crime-thriller Shiva at IFFI Goa 2025 Nagarjuna and the Annapurna Studios team detailed the seven-year odyssey of restoring the crime-thriller 'Shiva' for 4K release, including the miracle of retrieving missing audio from prints stored by passionate exhibitors across Telugu states.

Aamir Khan says Dharmendra watched Sunny Deol's Lahore 1947, loved script Aamir Khan recalled his recent meetings with Dharmendra, including sharing Lahore 1947 with the late actor. He also spoke about their connection at the International Film Festival of India.

Dharmendra's emotional poem in Ikkis is an ode to his beloved pind. Watch Makers of Ikkis released a video featuring a special poem recited by veteran actor Dharmendra. The clip is a special tribute to the veteran actor who died on November 24.

Gustaakh Ishq review: Naseeruddin Shah anchors love that grows too sugary too soonRelease Date:Fri Nov 28, 2025 Gustaakh Ishq depends heavily on old-school romance, offering a world drenched in nostalgia and slow-brewing affection. Naseeruddin Shah delivers a towering performance that lifts the film every time he appears on-screen. But this is too much sweetness, even for lovers of love story.
Kiara Advani-Sidharth Malhotra share first pic of daughter, reveal her name Kiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra have shared the first photo of their daughter and revealed her name.

Revolver Rita review: Keerthy Suresh's black comedy falls flatRelease Date:Fri Nov 28, 2025 Revolver Rita movie review: Directed by JK Chandru, Revolver Rita, starring Keerthy Suresh, Radhika Sarathkumar, and Sunil, is pegged as a black comedy revolving around a crime. The film is neither dark nor funny, just flat as discarded cardboard.

Ranbir-Deepika's next to be based on Raj Kapoor-Nargis' Chori Chori: Sources Deepika Padukone and Ranbir Kapoor fans will rejoice as the two actors are set to reunite after a decade for Aya Mukerji's next project. India Today has exclusively learnt that the film is loosely adapted from Raj Kapoor and Nargis's 1956 classic Chori Chori.

Hema Malini posts family pics of Dharmendra in new emotional tribute on Instagram Hema Malini posted rare family moments with late husband Dharmendra. The photos featured Dharmendra with Hema, and their daughters Ahana and Esha Deol.

Ashlesha-Sandeep on getting married after 23 years: Happened when it was meant to Actors Ashlesha Savant and Sandeep Baswana got married after 23 years of companionship. In a conversation with India Today, the couple opened up about their intimate wedding in Vrindavan.

Actor Kevin Spacey sued again, three new sexual assault cases head to UK court Three men have brought separate civil claims of sexual assault against Kevin Spacey in London, covering incidents alleged to have taken place between 2000 and 2013. The Oscar-winning actor has denied two of the new claims, with a trial date provisionally set for October 2026.

Eternity review: A tender, tidy rom-com with its heart in the right afterlifeRelease Date:Fri Nov 28, 2025 Eternity movie review: Eternity is a rom-com set in a whimsical afterlife where an elderly woman chooses her eternity. The film explores love, memory, and the difficult decisions that shape life without villainising any character, says our review.

Delhi High Court backs Ajay Devgn's personality rights, orders deepfake takedown The Delhi High Court has granted interim relief to actor Ajay Devgn, restraining unauthorised use of his personality traits and ordering removal of obscene content, following allegations of misuse through commercial merchandise and artificial intelligence.

general news.headline: India's new quake map puts entire Himalayas in highest danger zoneThis marks one of the most significant shifts in seismic hazard assessment in decades, revealing that 61% of the country now falls under moderate to high hazard zones.​

Trump's migration pause: What are Third World countries? Is India among them?Third World Countries: US President Donald Trump, escalating his hardline immigration rhetoric, said he will 'permanently pause' migration from all Third World countries. What do Third World countries mean? Is India on the list?

What Imran Khan's last post says amid his disappearance in custodyThere has been no word from former Pakistan PM Imran Khan in the last 24 days. This comes amid the denial of the court-mandated meetings for his family and party members. At this moment, the last social media post on behalf of Imran Khan provides crucial insight. There's repeated mention of "one person, Asim Munir" in the post from November 5.

Why wasn't Sindh, like Bengal and Punjab, partitioned between India and Pak?Unlike Punjab or Bengal, where the Partition in 1947 gave parts to India and Pakistan, Sindh went completely to the Islamic nation. Its rivers, cities, and centuries of shared culture left behind and uprooted Sindhi Hindus from their homeland. Why isn't any part of Sindh, which finds mention in India's National Anthem, in India?

Row over minister applauding obscene dance at Udhayanidhi Stalin's birthday partyA video showed Tamil Nadu Minister S Periyakaruppan allegedly inviting young female performers to dance closer at Deputy Chief Minister Uhdayanidhi Stalin's birthday event.

Trump orders review of Green Cards from 19 countries after National Guard shootingTrump ordered a review of Biden-era asylum approvals and Green Cards from 19 high-risk countries. USCIS issued new rules allowing officers to treat origin countries as negative factors in immigration screening.

145 killed, thousands displaced as unprecedented floods cripple southern ThailandRescue teams are now accessing previously submerged localities as waters recede, revealing widespread destruction to homes, roads, and infrastructure.

IIT Bombay to IIT Mumbai? What students and experts thinkThe Maharashtra government is set to request the Centre to rename IIT Bombay as IIT Mumbai, reigniting a long-standing debate over institutional nomenclature. As political reactions intensify, students and experts are weighing in on what such a change could mean.

Deaths in Hong Kong high-rise blaze rise to 128 as more bodies recoveredThe death toll has climbed again as police make arrests over alleged safety lapses at the site. With more bodies recovered and three construction officials now in custody, the scale of the disaster continues to deepen.

India has become the world's accountant. Yet we are still paid like internsA massive shift in global finance is underway and India is powering it. Yet the people doing the work are not earning what the world is willing to pay

Live: PM Modi condoles Sri Lanka deaths, India sends aid under Op Sagar BandhuCyclone Ditwah Live Updates: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said Cyclonic Storm Ditwah is moving toward the coasts of Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and southern Andhra Pradesh and is expected to make landfall on November 30. The storm originated over the southwest Bay of Bengal near Pottuvil in Sri Lanka and is moving north-northwest. Ditwah made landfall early Friday morning on Sri Lanka's eastern coast and moved northwest toward India, causing widespread damage and killing 56 people in Sri Lanka. It is currently classified as a cyclonic storm, with no forecast of intensifying into a severe cyclone. Tamil Nadu has issued a red alert for four districts and an orange alert for five districts in preparation for the storm. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

BJP leaders gather to bless UP couple, stage collapses; video goes viralA wedding reception in Ballia, Uttar Pradesh, turned chaotic when the stage collapsed under the weight of senior BJP leaders, causing the bride, groom and guests to fall. Thankfully, no serious injuries were reported in this unexpected mishap that has now gone viral on social media.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Envoy says no ban but Pakistanis aren't getting UAE visas | Explained in 3 pointsThe UAE's consulate in Karachi said there was no blanket ban on Pakistanis for visas, and all visa types were being processed. However, reports suggest a rejection rate of 80% for first-time applicants seeking to travel to Dubai. This is all about the UAE's near-ban on visas in Pakistan and its impact.

44 Indians headline blockbuster WPL auction as franchises cash in on homegrown starsThe 2026 WPL mega auction was dominated by Indian talent, with 44 players earning contracts led by Deepti Sharma's joint-record RTM signing. Franchises focused heavily on homegrown strength, shaping what could be the most competitive WPL season yet.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma lead India's practice in Ranchi ahead of 1st ODIVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma had their first net session in Ranchi ahead of India's first ODI against South Africa. The star duo return for their first international game since playing the 3-match ODI series in Australia.

Jr. Men's Hockey World Cup: PR Sreejesh's young India chase third titleThe Indian team will be aiming to win their third title as they step on to the field for the Jr.men's Hockey World Cup in Chennai and Madurai, starting from November 28. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
